title: chore(ci): notify about docs building failure on Discord #alerts
test: port ecash_backup_can_recover_metadata
body:
Working towards https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/issues/3234

Ports `ecash_backup_can_recover_metadata` from the legacy integration tests.

https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/blob/1132d742c2357fd70a0c3691636f80637edc0adb/integrationtests/tests/tests.rs#L288

title: feat: Support description hashes for invoices
body: This is needed along with #3820 for the lightning address server. Without being able to set the description hash some clients will reject the invoice as invalid and will make all resulting zaps invalid as well.

title: fix: define nextest `dev` profile
body:
We recently introduced exporting `CARGO_PROFILE="dev"` when sourcing `scripts/_common.sh` (see: https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/blob/f001570/scripts/_common.sh#L14). We need to define a `dev` profile for nextest or `just test-ci-all` fails locally with

```bash
nix@lenovo-m75q-ubuntu:~/fedimint$ just test-ci-all
./scripts/tests/test-ci-all.sh
Pre-building workspace...
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.26s
Pre-building tests...
error: profile `dev not found (known profiles: ci, default, default-miri)`
error: Recipe `test-ci-all` failed on line 19 with exit code 96
```

title: chore(devimint): add assert_error function
body:
@elsirion had some good non-blocking feedback to improve the API for interacting with `fedimint-cli` errors in devimint.

https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/pull/4563#discussion_r1527440037

title: feat: allow access to FederationError
body: We can match on this error and show good error messages on the client.

title: chore: improve error of download config
body: now returns the correct error with added context

title: chore: remove async from TaskGroup::spawn
body:
fixes https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/issues/4493

command used for replace:

	rust-analyzer ssr '$tg.spawn($n, $f).await ==>> $tg.spawn($n, $f)'

title: chore(devimint): polling maybe a bit too aggressive
body:
Brad was right, I was wrong.

I'm not worried about the performance, but the flood of logging messages is inconvenient.

title: chore: improve logging
body: Mostly deviming, downgrading level and unifying certain things.

title: refactor(consensus): rename `debug` to `debug_fmt`
body:
Auto-completion keeps suggesting it instead of `tracing::debug`.

After I just renamed it to `debug_fmt`, it occured to me that `pub(crate)` would probably do, but I still think it's a better name for this module, so I kept it.

title: chore: disable deprecation warnings
body: See comment.

title: docs: add section on cachix to dev-env docs
body: Ran into this footgun trying to get a dev environment set up. Since it's in the bootstrap script it makes sense to include it here as well. Closes #2149.

title: chore(latency-tests): reissue more notes
body:
Reissuing is so fast now, that it's hard to bench any potential improvements. Issue more notes, to make it work harder.

In my tests, when using `ci` build profile:

Before:

LATENCY REISSUE: min: 0.6s, avg: 0.7s, median: 0.6s, p90: 0.7s, max: 0.7s, sum: 19.5s

Now:

LATENCY REISSUE: min: 1.3s, avg: 1.4s, median: 1.4s, p90: 1.5s, max: 1.5s, sum: 42.4s

title: chore(client): too chatty
body: In a default (`info`) logging level `fedimint-cli` should only print most important and infrequent messages, and not be soo chatty.

title: fix(db): version field migration never completing
body:
I've noticed the `fedimint-cli` keeps printing over and over:

```
2024-03-16T21:45:20.473825Z  INFO db: Migrating DatabaseVersionKeyV0 of ln to DatabaseVersionKey. Version: 1
2024-03-16T21:45:20.473877Z  INFO db: Migrating DatabaseVersionKeyV0 of mint to DatabaseVersionKey. Version: 0
2024-03-16T21:45:20.473899Z  INFO db: Migrating DatabaseVersionKeyV0 of wallet to DatabaseVersionKey. Version:
 0
2024-03-16T21:45:20.473917Z  INFO db: Migrating DatabaseVersionKeyV0 of meta to DatabaseVersionKey. Version: 0
2
```

and it seems it actually never completes it, because there is nothing else to migrate and transaction is terminated early, without completing this one migration. In other words - it does some modifications, than never calls the `commit`.

title: fix(devimint-env): `set -euo pipefail` missing
body:
Trust me, you're going to have a great time if you use `just devimint-env` to test stuff, and sometimes you'll be running previous version because it ignored compilation error.

This change denies anyone that fun. Sorry.

title: chore(fedimint-cli): print locking message  only if lock busy
body: With recent dependency updates, this is now possible. I know because I contributed it, just so I can eventually get it to work like this. :D

title: fix(ci): test-ci-all running `parallel` with `--eta`
body: `[ -t 1 ]` is true when running in terminal + a flag to disable it from Nix script.

title: chore(devimint-env): fixes & improvements
body: As I am beginning to use it, I discover problems and tweak things.

title: feat: federation_id guardian endpoint
body: Closed https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/pull/4559 in favor of this to clean force pushes / git history, just adds federation_id endpoint to not affect global client config backwards compat but still be able to get it from the guardian ui.

title: chore(metrics): monitor application start with version and ver-hash
chore: disable flaky ecash_oob_highly_parallel
body:
We're observing a higher failure rate causing CI bottlenecks. Disabling for now.

https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/issues/4508#issuecomment-2000407244

title: fix: test_gateway_configuration
body:
Fixes: https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/issues/4290

No longer flaky!

title: Followup - Fix CI on master
body:
Followup to https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/pull/4490

Closes https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/issues/4243

The symlink works but we were missing the Dockerfile. Also updates the context path for prosody.

```
ERROR: failed to solve: failed to read dockerfile: open docker/latest/mutinynet-bitcoind-docker/Dockerfile: no such file or directory
```
https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/actions/runs/8299123739/job/22714103048

title: refactor: Move db.rs into server crates
body:
There is no reason for db.rs to be in the common crates, since the client and server databases are separate and don't store the same things.

This PR moves db.rs for each of the modules into the server crates from common.

title: fix: make clang available in fuzz shell
body:
I don't know how fuzzing worked for others, but I had to add `clang` to the dev env, otherwise `honggfuzz` would fail to compile with

```
  make: clang: No such file or directory
```

Follow-up to  #4494

title: refactor(metrics): combined and polish existing ln module metrics
body:
Use `direction` label to combine contract funding metrics.

Drop the counters, histograms already track `<metric>_count`
anyway.

Shorten the names.

Add human-readable descriptions.

title: chore(fedimint-cli): write json error to stdout
body: Closes https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/issues/4558

title: chore(dev-env): `just devimint-env`
body:
Copy&paste in `mprocs` is always annoying. I started improving tmux working in nested tmux, but then it occured to me, that I actually don't want devimint starting either.

All I really want is a shell inside devimint environment. I can `tail` logs myself if I need to (I usually don't). And that's what `just devimint-env` is.

Please give it a try locally before approving. High chance there are some details that can fail on different shells/systems, even if I tried to keep it *really* simple.

title: chore(ci): print version prefixes in parallel task joblog as well
chore(deps): bump hyper from 0.14.28 to 1.2.0
body:
Bumps [hyper](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper) from 0.14.28 to 1.2.0.
Release notes

Sourced from hyper's releases.

v1.2.0

Features

  • http1: support configurable max_headers(num) to client and server (#3523) (b1142448)
  • http2:
    • add config for max_local_error_reset_streams in server (#3530) (d7680e30)
    • add initial_max_send_streams method to HTTP/2 client builder (#3524) (fdfa60d9)
      • NOTE: The default for this will change in v1.3 to something conservative. If you have an environment where the server can always accept a large amount of concurrent streams, and depend on that for performance, you should set this option manually.
    • add max_pending_accept_reset_streams(num) back to HTTP/2 server builder (#3507 (a9fa893f)

Bug Fixes

  • http2: typo in trace logging (#3536) (79862ec2)
  • rt: Sleep::downcast_mut_pin() no longer extend lifetime (7206fe30, closes #3556)

Breaking Changes

  • The returned lifetime from Sleep::downcast_mut_pin() is no longer 'static. This shouldn't affect most usage. This sort of breaking change is needed because it is wrong. (7206fe30)

New Contributors

  • @​getong made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3503
  • @​dsgallups made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3507
  • @​magurotuna made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3524
  • @​erebe made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3536
  • @​wfly1998 made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3523

v1.1.0

Features

  • client: add http1::Connection without_shutdown() method (#3430) (210bfaa7)
  • http1: Add support for sending HTTP/1.1 Chunked Trailer Fields (#3375) (31b41807, closes #2719)
  • server: expose server::conn::http1::UpgradeableConnection (#3457) (6e3042a8)

Bug Fixes

  • http1:
    • add internal limit for chunked extensions (#3495) (d71ff962)
    • reject chunked headers missing a digit (#3494) (82915386)

New Contributors

  • @​acedogblast made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3433
  • @​hatoo made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3434
  • @​allan2 made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3449
  • @​daxhuiberts made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3464
  • @​ncihnegn made their first contribution in hyperium/hyper#3479

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from hyper's changelog.

v1.2.0 (2024-02-21)

Bug Fixes

  • http2: typo in trace logging (#3536) (79862ec2)
  • rt: Sleep::downcast_mut_pin() no longer extend lifetime (7206fe30, closes #3556)

Features

  • http1: support configurable max_headers(num) to client and server (#3523) (b1142448)
  • http2:
    • add config for max_local_error_reset_streams in server (#3530) (d7680e30)
    • add initial_max_send_streams method to HTTP/2 client builder (#3524) (fdfa60d9)
    • add max_pending_accept_reset_streams(num) back to HTTP/2 server builder (#3507 (a9fa893f)

Breaking Changes

  • The returned lifetime from Sleep::downcast_mut_pin() is no longer 'static. This shouldn't affect most usage. This sort of breaking change is needed because it is wrong.

(7206fe30)

v1.1.0 (2023-12-18)

Bug Fixes

  • http1:
    • add internal limit for chunked extensions (#3495) (d71ff962)
    • reject chunked headers missing a digit (#3494) (82915386)

Features

  • client: add http1::Connection without_shutdown() method (#3430) (210bfaa7)
  • http1: Add support for sending HTTP/1.1 Chunked Trailer Fields (#3375) (31b41807, closes #2719)
  • server: expose server::conn::http1::UpgradeableConnection (#3457) (6e3042a8)

v1.0.1 (2023-11-16)

This release "fixes" or adds a few things that should have been in 1.0.0, but were forgotten. Thus, it includes additions that would normally be a semver-minor release, but because it is so close to 1.0.0, it is released as a patch version.

Bug Fixes

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 198c1b9 v1.2.0
  • a7bdc60 refactor(lib): importing Unpin is not needed in 2021 edition
  • 00a703a chore(ci): update to cargo-check-external-types 0.1.11
  • b0c1395 refactor(error): resolve unused trait error
  • 7206fe3 fix(rt): Sleep::downcast_mut_pin() no longer extend lifetime
  • 90eb95f chore(lib): remove importing prelude trait in 2021 edition (#3546)
  • b114244 feat(http1): support configurable max_headers(num) to client and server (#3...
  • 7177770 chore(lib): update to 2021 edition
  • 7a0a640 docs(maintainers): add dswij (@​dswij) to triagers (#3540)
  • 79862ec fix(http2): typo in trace logging (#3536)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=hyper&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=0.14.28&new-version=1.2.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: chore(ci): cleanup output and print times in test-ci-all
chore: make the test-ci-all work harder
fix: modules with empty params are broken
chore: make `fedimnt-cli module <module>` be positional
body:
I know that I'm usually advocating for long/named arguments but:

```
fedimint-cli module --module meta get-consensus
```

is just silly. Instead if we:

```
fedimint-cli module meta get-consensus
```

along with some other improvements I'm working on will make module-specific CLI a first class citizens of fedimint-cli.

title: refactor: remove ldk node in fedimint-testing
body: The LDK implementation we use for testing right now is currently flaky and does not add much coverage anyway. We are going to be adding LDK as a first-class citizen in the gateway (https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/pull/4338), in which case we will actually have two implementations of similar interfaces for LDK. I think it makes sense to just remove the existing LDK implementation that is only used for testing and work towards supporting `ldk-node` inside of the gateway.

title: chore: get rid of WsAdminClient
body:
Re #4519

I wrote it just to see if it's possible and everything still works.

Now I think we might tweak `IRawFederationApi` a bit and retain ability to do both. I.e. split `IRawFederationApi::all_peers` into `all_peers` + `admin_peer`, so that  `FederationApiExt::request_admin` can call only the admin, while other requests  - all guardians.

But one way or another I think getting rid of `WsAdminClient` is easy and the right thing to do.

title: test: get denomination from mint server config
body: Resolves outstanding TODO in `test_detect_double_spends`.

title: chore: `meta` module
body:
## Overview

Meta module is meant to allow guardians to collectively setup and change over time a set of values for various auxiliary purposes, e.g.: establish customization of Federation like welcome messages, ToS and other legal documents, references to community information, chat servers, etc. This way the end user Fedimint client applications can discover these settings and customize the user experience per-federation. 

It acts as a simple key-value store, where each guardian can submit a proposed value for a given key, and if `threshold` number of peers submit the same value, it becomes an official consensus.

This module is intentionally simple and limited in scope.

The keys are effectively a single byte, so there can only ever be 256 of them. Server side module does not interpret these values in any way and treats them as opaque binary blobs.

It is up to the community of Fedimint end user applications to establish the meaning and format of meta module values. The initial intention is to use a single key with the value of a json string. The structure of that JSON document is open-ended and can be estabilished and evolved over time, and applications can gracefully handle it in backward and forward compatible way.

This is all to move the more social consensus around Federation management outside / on top-of the hard to evolve Fedimint consensus.

The extra 255 keys are an escape hatch - to avoid dealing with module consensus changes if a single value ever turns out to not be enough.

We should follow up with some partitioning and allocation of these keys, and the Json schema for ones deemed to be used as Json (default one 0 at least).

## Testing

`just mprocs` and then try:

```
fedimint-cli module meta help
fedimint-cli --our-id 1 --password asdf module meta submit '{ "a": "b"}'
fedimint-cli --our-id 1 --password asdf module meta get-submissions
```

etc.

See if you can figure it out. :)

### References

* https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/tree/master/docs/meta_fields

### Status

I think everything is there. Now needs some feedback, tests, fixes and merging.

For reviewers - there are some nifty details and improvements that I accumulated along the way. Some of them pushed as separate PRs already, some integral to the change.

TODO:

* [ ] write some (devimint?) tests
* [ ] fix back-compat - probably something about new module

title: chore: add `fedimint-empty` module
body:
Initiaially the goal of `fedimint-dummy` module was to be a good template to start a new module.

But with time, it was hijacked to be become `fedimint-`"print me money out of thin air" module (aka `fedimint-federal-reserve` module), and it now actually contains quite a bit of code.

So when trying to use it as a starting point, one needs to go a rename, delete and fix more code than neccessary.

This module is a clone of `fedimint-dummy`, but with almost everything removed.

It will get compiled, but will not be used for anything anywhere.

title: chore: add method to get recover progress
feat: Rename federation_id() to calculate_federation_id()
body:
The name federation_id() makes it sound like it is just retrieving the id, however it is actually calculating a hash and can take a mild amount of cpu power. Renaming this to calculate_federation_id() implies that there is some work being done and the user should instantiate it as a variable to not duplicate that work.

Found a place where this was happening in the codebase already. We did this in several places in Mutiny too.

title: fix: api discovery task not being cancellable
body:
Use a task_group.

On top of ... too many PRs, because merge conflicts and CI being stuck ATM. Can rebase when the dust clears.

title: chore(client): on first start, get api version from half of clients
body:
This blocking of client on a first start is slowing everything down and creating a lot of problems. A simple solution would be to go fast and optimistic on the first start.

Subsequent runs will happen in the background, so then we can do slow, but more precise negotiation.

title: fix: decrease api discovery timeouts in dev shell and tests
body:
We started getting slow test and timeouts in the CI:

https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/actions/runs/8198894922/job/22423145415

caused by #4476.

Turns out there are other tests just degraded federation tests that run with degraded federations.

Generally in dev shell, tests and CI, we can just default to 10 seconds timeout, should be enough even under heavy load.

title: chore: add DoS protection against infinite reader on decoding
body:
This is based on the same API/traits from rust-bitcoin:

https://docs.rs/bitcoin/latest/bitcoin/consensus/encode/trait.Decodable.html#method.consensus_decode_from_finite_reader

Fix #4395

On top of #287 .

A problem was incidentally discovered when fuzzing the whole thing and the fix already has a merge conflict, so is tagging along.

title: chore(bench-compilation): improve output, bench check etc.
fix: stick with done progress in recovery handling
feat: fuzzing
body: How to use: see ./docs/fuzzing.md

title: feat: manual shutdown of client
body: on top #4484

title: Fix CI on master
body:
- [x] Extra docker containers
- [x] Docs

title: chore: increase cross compile timeout in CI
body:
Context: https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/pull/4476#issuecomment-1982263388

Issue to track reverting: https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/issues/4488

title: refactor(client): remove manual client arc counting
body:
On top of #4482 



Use two levels of `Arc` instead. While at it, rename and document things
better.

title: fix: wrong git version hash calculated if source dirty
body:
Mathz are hard.

Hey, at least it's not off by 1.

title: chore: client shutdown on handle drop incorrect
body:
Fundamentally we can't rely on database count to detect when client executors (state machines and recoveries) finished, because external user might hold some references too.

Also, we must not be dropping `inner : Arc<Client>` before we ensure executors stopped, because something running in them might still require that `Arc<Client>` is alive and weak references to them can be upgraded.

Instead use the old and (somewhat) trusted TaskGroup to do the job.

title: chore(deps): bump tempfile from 3.10.0 to 3.10.1
body:
Bumps [tempfile](https://github.com/Stebalien/tempfile) from 3.10.0 to 3.10.1.
Changelog

Sourced from tempfile's changelog.

3.10.1

  • Handle potential integer overflows in 32-bit systems when seeking/truncating "spooled" temporary files past 4GiB (2³²).
  • Handle a theoretical 32-bit overflow when generating a temporary file name larger than 4GiB. Now it'll panic (on allocation failure) rather than silently succeeding due to wraparound.

Thanks to @​stoeckmann for finding and fixing both of these issues.

Commits
  • 094c115 chore: release 3.10.1
  • 56c5934 Fix integer overflows and truncation (#278)
  • 5a949d6 chore: 2021 edition (#276)

title: chore: timeouts on version discovery
body:
When working locally I've noticed test failing due to too short api discovery timeout.

Parametrize timeout of api version discovery using env variable. Set it to low value only when testing offline nodes.

title: include wasm-test.sh in test-ci-all (almost)
body:
This required:

* reachitecting flakebox target vs toolchain handling
* fixing wasm-test.sh to stop invalidating ./target
* bunch of nix glue to stich native vs wasm32-unknown ./targets together
* continuously ignoring the question is it even worth the time

Unfortunately after tackling all the scripts & Nix issues, it turned out that wasm-tests (headless firefox?) just doesn't work when being run in GNU `parallel` or `xargs -P`, and debugging it seems like lots of work.

So we'll still run wasm-test separately, but at least it will now re-use build artifacts with the main build, so it should still be faster. And in the future we can try again.

title: feat: dev commands to decode and encode notes and invite_code to and from json
body:
replaces https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/pull/4449

Adds dev codes for fedimint-cli to encode/decode to/from json for notes and invite_code

Would it be out of scope to add cashu encoding here? It'd just rename the keys and put the amount in each of the notes then spit out the json

title: chore(ci): in PR and MQ, build ci version of containers
feat(dev): `just bench-compilation`
body: See https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/wiki/Benchmark-compilation-times

title: chore: move dev shell target to `./target-nix`
body:
People quite often report problems with constant rebuilds when using VSCode and other IDEs started outside of the dev shell.

These dev shells are using different rust-analyzer and Rust toolchain versions that mututally invalidate each other with dev shell setup.

While there are ways to configure such IDEs to co-exist with dev shell, they require customizing every text editor for every user.

We can't easily control IDEs of everyone, but we have a perfect control of the dev shell. It seems quite easy to just get out of the way, not use the default `./target` and problem mostly solved:

Dev shell users won't really notice the change, mostly.

Shell scripts need to use `CARGO_BUILD_TARGET_DIR`.

IDE users will have a separate ./target and ./target-nix, but it seems much better then suffering constant rebuilds of everything.

title: fix(ci): stop notifing about failing merge queue builds
chore: add stalled-download-timeout nix config in CI
body:
We'll occasionally see network issues with cachix in CI (again today - [run](https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/actions/runs/8156982333/job/22295596321), [discord](https://discord.com/channels/990354215060795454/1075857804692295720/1214568693036744744)).

We've previously tried `connect-timeout` (see: https://github.com/fedimint/fedimint/pull/4401), but are still seeing issues. In my local env I've seen similar errors, which have been resolved by adding `stalled-download-timeout = 15` (default: 300s).

https://nixos.org/manual/nix/stable/command-ref/conf-file#conf-stalled-download-timeout

title: chore(deps): bump jsonrpsee-types from 0.21.0 to 0.22.2
body:
Bumps [jsonrpsee-types](https://github.com/paritytech/jsonrpsee) from 0.21.0 to 0.22.2.
Release notes

Sourced from jsonrpsee-types's releases.

v0.22.2

[v0.22.2] - 2024-03-05

This is a small patch release that exposes the connection details to server methods without breaking changes. Currently, users can only retrieve the connection ID from these details. We plan to extend this functionality in jsonrpsee v1.0, although this will necessitate a breaking change.

[Added]

  • server: Register raw method with connection ID (#1297)

[Changed]

  • Update Syn 1.0 -> 2.0 (#1304)

v0.22.1

[v0.22.1] - 2024-02-19

This is a small patch release that internally changes AtomicU64 to AtomicUsize to support more targets.

[Fixed]

  • fix(docs): part of proc-macro documentation not rendering correctly in IDE (#1294)
  • fix(client): change to AtomicU64 to AtomicUsize (#1293)
  • fix(server): low-level API return err on WS handshake err (#1288)

v0.22.0

[v0.22.0] - 2024-02-07

Another breaking release where a new ResponsePayload type is introduced in order to make it possible to determine whether a response has been processed.

Unfortunately, the IntoResponse trait was modified to enable that and some minor changes were made to make more fields private to avoid further breakage.

Example of the async ResponsePayload API

#[rpc(server)]
pub trait Api {
	#[method(name = "x")]
	fn x(&self) -> ResponsePayload<'static, String>;
}

impl RpcServer for () {
fn x(&self) -> ResponsePayload<'static, String> {
let (rp, rp_done) = ResponsePayload::success("ehheeheh".to_string()).notify_on_completion();


	tokio::spawn(async move {
		if rp_done.await.is_ok() {
			do_task_that_depend_x();



</tr></table>

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from jsonrpsee-types's changelog.

[v0.22.2] - 2024-03-05

This is a small patch release that exposes the connection details in server method implementations without breaking changes. We plan to extend this functionality in jsonrpsee v1.0, although this will necessitate a breaking change.

[Added]

  • server: Register raw method with connection ID (#1297)

[Changed]

  • Update Syn 1.0 -> 2.0 (#1304)

[v0.22.1] - 2024-02-19

This is a small patch release that internally changes AtomicU64 to AtomicUsize to support more targets.

[Fixed]

  • fix(docs): part of proc-macro documentation not rendering correctly in IDE (#1294)
  • fix(client): change to AtomicU64 to AtomicUsize (#1293)
  • fix(server): low-level API return err on WS handshake err (#1288)

[v0.22.0] - 2024-02-07

Another breaking release where a new ResponsePayload type is introduced in order to make it possible to determine whether a response has been processed.

Unfortunately, the IntoResponse trait was modified to enable that and some minor changes were made to make more fields private to avoid further breakage.

Example of the async ResponsePayload API

#[rpc(server)]
pub trait Api {
	#[method(name = "x")]
	fn x(&self) -> ResponsePayload<'static, String>;
}

impl RpcServer for () {
fn x(&self) -> ResponsePayload<'static, String> {
let (rp, rp_done) = ResponsePayload::success("ehheeheh".to_string()).notify_on_completion();


	tokio::spawn(async move {
		if rp_done.await.is_ok() {
			do_task_that_depend_x();
		}
	});

title: chore(deps): bump http from 0.2.11 to 1.1.0
body:
Bumps [http](https://github.com/hyperium/http) from 0.2.11 to 1.1.0.
Release notes

Sourced from http's releases.

v1.1.0

What's Changed

  • Add methods to allow trying to allocate in the HeaderMap, returning an error if oversize instead of panicking.
  • Add Extensions::get_or_insert() method.
  • Implement From<Uri> for uri::Builder.
  • Fix HeaderName::from_lowercase that could allow NUL bytes in some cases.

New Contributors

  • @​tottoto made their first contribution in hyperium/http#645
  • @​julianbraha made their first contribution in hyperium/http#652
  • @​LukeMathWalker made their first contribution in hyperium/http#654
  • @​mattgathu made their first contribution in hyperium/http#660
  • @​LukasKalbertodt made their first contribution in hyperium/http#667
  • @​dswij made their first contribution in hyperium/http#673

Full Changelog: https://github.com/hyperium/http/compare/v1.0.0...v1.1.0

v1.0.0

What's Changed

  • Implement Clone for Request, Response, and Extensions. This breaking change requires that all extensions now implement Clone.
  • Add a default-on std feature. Disabling it currently is not supported.
  • Fix MIRI warnings in HeaderMap::iter().

New Contributors

  • @​hjr3 made their first contribution in hyperium/http#644

v0.2.12

What's Changed

  • Add methods to allow trying to allocate in the HeaderMap, returning an error if oversize instead of panicking.
  • Fix HeaderName::from_lowercase that could allow NUL bytes in some cases.
Changelog

Sourced from http's changelog.

1.1.0 (March 4, 2024)

  • Add methods to allow trying to allocate in the HeaderMap, returning an error if oversize instead of panicking.
  • Add Extensions::get_or_insert() method.
  • Implement From<Uri> for uri::Builder.
  • Fix HeaderName::from_lowercase that could allow NUL bytes in some cases.

1.0.0 (November 15, 2023)

  • Implement Clone for Request, Response, and Extensions. This breaking change requires that all extensions now implement Clone.
  • Add a default-on std feature. Disabling it currently is not supported.
  • Fix MIRI warnings in HeaderMap::iter().

0.2.10 (November 10, 2023)

  • Fix parsing of Authority to handle square brackets in incorrect order.
  • Fix HeaderMap::with_capacity() to handle arithmetic overflow.

0.2.9 (February 17, 2023)

  • Add HeaderName constants for cache-status and cdn-cache-control.
  • Implement Hash for PathAndQuery.
  • Re-export HeaderName at crate root.

0.2.8 (June 6, 2022)

  • Fix internal usage of uninitialized memory to use MaybeUninit inside HeaderName.

0.2.7 (April 28, 2022)

  • MSRV bumped to 1.49.
  • Add extend() method to Extensions.
  • Add From<Authority> and From<PathAndQuery> impls for Uri.
  • Make HeaderName::from_static a const fn.

0.2.6 (December 30, 2021)

  • Upgrade internal itoa dependency to 1.0.

0.2.5 (September 21, 2021)

  • Add is_empty() and len() methods to Extensions.
  • Add version_ref() method to request::Builder.
  • Implement TryFrom<Vec<u8>> and TryFrom<String> for Authority, Uri, PathAndQuery, and HeaderName.
  • Make HeaderValue::from_static a const fn.

0.2.4 (April 4, 2021)

  • Fix Uri parsing to allow {, ", and } in paths.

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 3fe7267 v1.1.0
  • 96dc52f fix: HeaderName::from_lowercase allowing NUL bytes in some cases
  • caa8b4f feat: add HeaderMap::try_ methods to handle capacity overflow
